cards.name: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire
cards.text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
cards.flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."

cards.name: Deja Vu
cards.text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
cards.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

cards.name: Demolition Run
cards.text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
cards.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

cards.name: Stimhack
cards.text: Make a run, and gain 9[Credits], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[Credits] not spent.

cards.name: Cyberfeeder
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
cards.flavor: I feel almost naked without it.

cards.name: Grimoire
cards.text: +2[Memory Units] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard

cards.name: Corroder
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credit]: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." -g00ru

cards.name: Datasucker
cards.text: Whenever you make a succesful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

cards.name: Djinn
cards.text: Djinn can host up to 3[Memory Units] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [Click], 1[Credit]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

cards.name: Medium
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D when you access cards from R&D.
cards.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.

cards.name: Mimic
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
cards.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.

cards.name: Parasite
cards.text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.

cards.name: Wyrm
cards.text:
3[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength.
1[Credit]: Ice has -1 strength.
1[Credit]: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: Fire and ichor...

cards.name: Yog.0
cards.text: 0[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
cards.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!

cards.name: Ice Carver
cards.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
cards.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.

cards.name: Wyldside
cards.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [Click].
cards.flavor:
"Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside."
-Ji "Noise" Reilly

cards.name: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
cards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[Credits].
cards.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."

cards.name: Account Siphon
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lost up to 5[Credits], then you gain 2[Credits] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.

cards.name: Inside Job
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
cards.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Som real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket..."

cards.name: Forged Activation Orders
cards.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
cards.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.

cards.name: Inside Job
cards.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
cards.flavor: "Hey, listen. I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."

cards.name: Special Order
cards.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later...

cards.name: Lemuria Codecracker
cards.text: [Click], 1[Credit]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
cards.flavor:
"A little preparation goes a long way."
-Gabriel Santiago

cards.name: Desperado
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Gain 1[Credit] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.

cards.name: Aurora
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.

cards.name: Femme Fatale
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may spend 1[Credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.

cards.name: Ninja
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
cards.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.

cards.name: Sneakdoor Beta
cards.text: [Click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
cards.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru

cards.name: Bank Job
cards.text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

cards.name: Crash Space
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
cards.flavor:
"My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yearh, there's a connection."
-Lez "Rockfist" S.

cards.name: Data Dealer
cards.text: Forfeit an agenda, [Click]: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.

cards.name: Decoy
cards.text: [Trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
cards.flavor:
"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."
